title: March Steps
description: A simple aerobic exercise where you lift your knees alternately as if walking or marching, either in place or moving forward.
steps: Stand upright with feet hip-width apart.
Lift one knee to hip level while swinging the opposite arm.
Lower it and repeat with the other leg.
Continue at a steady rhythm; increase speed or height for intensity.
benefits: Boosts heart rate and cardiovascular fitness.
Aids joint mobility—especially good for Parkinson’s.
Can be done anywhere, no equipment needed.
